events.body: For context, this has accounted for 12 of the last 571 failures (2.1%).
Do I understand correctly that this test fails because bitcoind didn't start soon enough? So it could be [same problem](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15367#issuecomment-762681497) I have?

issue.title: Bitcoind 0.21 problem heads up
issue.body:
Just a heads up that the new version of bitcoind sometimes gets stuck at start. I discovered it when trying to create a Debian package and [what looks like the same problem was found in bitcoind CI](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20654).

It *is* possible that I made some mistake, so you may decide to try it anyway with heavy testing. If you happen to find out please let me know.

I will try to be helpful if anyone wants to investigate but probably will not have a huge amount of time in the upcoming days/weeks.

issue.title: p2p: Make timeout mockable and type safe, speed up test
issue.body:
Use type-safe time for better code readability/maintainability and mockable time for better testability. This speeds up the p2p_timeout test.

This is also a bugfix for intermittent test issues like: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/4769904156999680?command=ci#L2836

Fixes #20654
